---
title: "Green pasta"
date: "2024-07-27"
categories: [vegetarian, easy]
---

![Johnny Miller for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Samantha Seneviratne.](https://static01.nyt.com/images/2024/06/20/multimedia/ab-extra-green-pasta-saladrex-mfqv/ab-extra-green-pasta-saladrex-mfqv-threeByTwoMediumAt2X.jpg?width=1280&quality=75&auto=webp)

---

- 1 lb short-cut pasta (such as rigatoni, campanelle or fusilli)
- 8 ounces sugar snap peas
- 2 cups frozen sweet peas
- 3 packed cups (4 oz) baby spinach
- 2 packed cups basil leaves, plus more for serving
- 2 tablespoons white miso
- 1 garlic clove, crushed
- Zest and juice from 1 lemon
- 1/2 cup olive oil
- Parmesan (or other firm salty cheese, such as feta or aged Gouda)
---

1. Make the noodles according to package directions. About 30 seconds before
they are done, add both types of peas.
1. Meanwhile, add spinach, basil, miso, garlic, and lemon zest and juice to 
a blender. Once mostly blended, slowly drizzle oil until incorporated. Season
to taste with salt and pepper.
1. Drain noodles and peas and mix with sauce. Serve with grated or sliced cheese.
